Class Player

java.lang.Object
game.characters.Character
game.characters.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Saveable
public class Player extends Character implements Saveable
The Player class represents the user-controlled character in the game. The player has health, attack power, an inventory, and a position within the game world. This class extends the abstract Character class and implements the Saveable interface so that player data can be written to a file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Constructs a Player with default stats. Sets max health, current health, attack power, and initializes the inventory.

    • Player

      public Player(int health, int attack)
      Constructs a Player with custom health and attack values.
      Parameters:
      health - initial health value
      attack - initial attack value

  • Method Details

    • takeTurn

      public void takeTurn(Player player)
      Defines how the player takes a turn. Overridden from Character, though player turns are controlled externally by user input.
      Specified by:
      takeTurn in class Character
      Parameters:
      player - the player affected (not used here)

      Specified by:
      saveData in interface Saveable
      Returns:
